Subject: BypassApp
Description:
Could you please help and check what BypassApp traffic is? It seems to be our web filtering apps. If I exclude it, would I be able to track staff file uploads?

We are using Endpoint protector provided host, Server ID: 49XMNYFY
What_We_Know__c:
2025.05.15
The customer was getting an overwhelming amount of DPI bypass events logs under "Report and Analysis" > " Content Aware Report".  They also stated that is Deep Packet Inspection with DPI Bypass is turned on then EPP is not able to enforce the CAP policy however this is not the case we we observed in the remote session that EPP still works as expected by enforcing CAP even with DPI Bypass turned.  To eliminate the noise with the setting turned on we showed the customer in the remote session where to turn off the event logs for DPI Bypass, we turned off the setting "DPI Bypass Event Logging".
Next_Steps__c:
2025.05.15
The customer will test the same settings on other endpoints and observe if EPP works as expected on those computers as well.  We are now waiting on an update from the customer.

2025.05.22
I sent the customer a follow up email asking for a status update on this ticket.

2025.05.23
Customer confirmed that Endpoint Protector works fine as expected after upgrade of the EPP client and confirmed that case can be closed.

2025.05.23
